Key Match Events: West Indies' Rovman Powell was stumped by South Africa's Quinton de Kock.
Roston Chase top-scored for West Indies with 52 from 42 balls.
Kyle Mayers made 35 off 34 balls and shared an 81-run partnership with Roston Chase.
Keshav Maharaj, Tabraiz Shamsi, and Aiden Markram bowled 12 overs of spin, stalling the West Indies' innings with 57 dot balls.
Andre Russell took two wickets for 19 runs, including Quinton de Kock and Reeza Hendricks.
An hour-long rain delay reduced South Africa's target to 123 in 17 overs via the DLS method.
Heinrich Klaasen hit a six and three boundaries off Gudakesh Motie in the seventh over, costing West Indies 20 runs.
Roston Chase took a wicket in each of his three overs, reducing South Africa to 110 for seven.
Marco Jansen hit a six off Obed McCoy in the last over to win the match for South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies were knocked out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup after a three-wicket loss to South Africa.
South Africa topped group II of the Super Eight phase with a perfect six points, maintaining their unbeaten run.
West Indies finished third in the group with two points and will have to wait for another occasion to try and lift a third T20 World Cup title.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a virtual quarterfinal, with the winner progressing to the semifinals.
The game was rain-affected and decided by the DLS method.
